executiveSummary: Entrepreneur Brook Canos pitched her product 'Tucky,' an elastic band designed to turn any top into a crop top, seeking $70,000 for 30% equity. After demonstrating the product's use and sharing sales of $60,000 in six months, Daymond John made a last-minute offer of $70,000 for 40%, which Brook accepted after a brief negotiation, citing his fashion expertise as a key reason.
keyDecisions: Brook Canos accepted Daymond John’s offer of $70,000 for 39% equity in Tucky.
nextSteps: Brook will begin working with Daymond John to scale Tucky’s business and leverage his fashion industry experience to expand brand visibility and sales.
